newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria 1997 inflation seen at 600 percent.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria 1997 inflation seen at 600 percent.

text.p: Bulgaria's interim prime minister Stefan Sofianski said on Thursday that he expected annual inflation for 1997 to be about 600 percent, lower than the 769 percent projected under last month's IMF standby accord.

"Bulgaria will project annual inflation of some 600 percent," he told reporters after meeting a visiting International Monetary Fund mission that is completing preparations to introduce a fixed exchange rate mechanism.
Sofianski said adjusting the inflation forecast would be one of the amendments to the 1997 budget draft under discussion with the IMF.
Consumer prices fell 0.7 percent month on month in April, compared with a 12.3 percent rise in March and a 242.7 percent rise in February.
Last week, finance minister designate Muravei Radev said parliament would approve the budget bill no later than the end of June.
The new cabinet of the Union of Democratic Forces, which won the April 19 general election, is expected to be presented to parliament on Wednesday.
